titleStmt.title: George W. Jones to J. M. Warring
CWG1477

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1862-1863

body.p: Sir your Letter of the 20 is at Hand and I now hasten to reply Wm H. Mefford is here but your order is not sufficient so says our state Prosecutor for me to make the arrest he is not aprised of our nollege about him I sent you a message to George Town but it was returned on acount of no operator in your place you can come on you had better get a requision for him to our Governor anything I can do for you will be properly attended to

Very Respectfully yours
Geo. W. Jones
City Marshal
I sent a certificate of Jim Lemon that was was indited in our court & all about him & Still he wont arrest tell me how to proceed if I had better get a requision for him
